meanings.definition: A state of nervousness or restlessness.
meanings.sent1: She had a case of the fantods before her big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The child's fantods were evident as he waited for his turn in line.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sudden fantods made everyone in the room jump.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead gave her a sense of fantods.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind outside added to the feeling of fantods in the old house.

meanings.definition: A sudden outburst of anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: His fantods surprised everyone in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't control her fantods when her computer crashed.
meanings.sent3: The dog's fantods at being left alone were quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The car's engine sputtering caused a wave of fantods in the driver.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's fantods were visible when the students kept talking during the lesson.

meanings.definition: A feeling of unease or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The dark alley gave her a sense of fantods.
meanings.sent2: He tried to shake off the fantods creeping up on him.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected noise in the quiet room caused a moment of fantods.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the forest filled her with a sense of fantods.
meanings.sent5: The unfamiliar surroundings brought on a wave of fantods for the lost hiker.
